medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Several days before admission, malaise, fatigue, increasing dyspnea, and chest tightness developed. One day before admission, the patient experienced significantly low blood pressure and rapid atrial fibrillation, leading to emergency transport due to worsening symptoms including ventricular tachycardia and loss of consciousness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Dilated nonischemic cardiomyopathy diagnosed in late 40s, history of atrial fibrillation, muscle weakness beginning 15 years prior with progressive symptoms including difficulty walking and gripping. Notable conditions include obstructive sleep apnea, sudden sensorineural hearing loss, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, morbid obesity, diabetes, among others.
medical_history.family_history: Father and one sister had an undefined neuromuscular problem; father had lung cancer and mother had uterine cancer; one child had scoliosis and a similar neuromuscular disorder.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol consumption, non-smoker, worked in a retail store, married with children.
